Posted: June 22, 2016
												This game is still incredibly fun after 10 years. Very well detailed, well written, and fun RTS. I've completed every campaign at least 5 times. The almost fully destructable environments are something you just don't see in even today's games. The only gripes I have are that it's almost too easy (certain missions are virtually impossible to fail), Snipers are VERY OP, minor AI issues, minor pathing issues, & no Achievements (came out before Steam made those).I've seen it go on sale time to time for about $2.50. For that price it is a can't miss.Highly Recommended.

content:
Posted: February 8
												One of the still standing RTS games from the old era. Empire Earth is dead, Age of Empires is dead. Long live Company of Heroes! The RTS system used in the Company of Heroes gameplay is vastly different from the other popular RTS of its era. It is highly recommended to go through the tutorial (as I did not the first time I played it) because the way you control and create units it is based on squads, and that gives the gameplay a lot more dynamism when you are openly battling the other factions and taking territories. The graphics are quite amazing, with destructible environment. You can even zoom in to see each of your units! Gameplay-wise this is a highly strategical game in which the occupation of territories actually holds a real value, compared to other RTS. So remember to have one or two squads around the corner ready to surprise the enemy, as they may not be expecting you to have rigged with explosives the bridge their tanks are in! This is a highly replayable, highly entertaining, time consuming RTS. Before I bought it in Steam I had the disc (oh, such times!) and I had some pretty amazing, long lasting matches which sometimes had to be called off because well... we needed to eat and let the sun outside hit us. Either way, in 2017 it still is a terrific game to be playing, either this one or the sequel, but keep up the support for this series!10/10Buy it, play it and don't regret it.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2015
 Company Of Heroes 2006 Genre: Rts, HistoricalActivity: MinimalWorkshop: NoDLC: YesUser reviews: 96% positiveMetacritic 93/100 Brief Description A semi-classic genre defining WW2 Real-time-strategy game with a sequal which means its not as active anymore.  My first impressions I recently got this game for $3.24 and honestly, I don't regret it. I got into the gameplay with the first hour of playing. There are so many play styles and game modes. 4v4, 3v3, 2v2, 1v1 with an assortment of AI difficulties, 60+ Maps, 2 gamemodes and many unique factions to choose from. I chose to do a full tank squad that consisted of 10 tanks that would dominate. The commanders options are pretty cool but get old quite quick. Pros 1. Great gameplay2. Multiple units to play with3. Wide varient of maps4. Battles5. Single-Player/skirmish6. Replayable7. The graphics have aged well8. Commander mode (Air/Infantry/Armoured focus modes)9. Cheap10. Amazing unit strats and commands Cons 1. Crashing is common2. 16 gig download but 7.6 gig download for the new steam version?3. Only 2 fractions without dlc4. Multiplayer is slightly dead5. Annoying camera controls6. Strange money system7. Tedious gameplay that can drag on if something stupid happens8. Fullscreen is bugged9. CoH 2 is out and only a bit more expensive ($8 price difference)10. Tanks dont always follow commands Overall I love this game due to the amount of maps and units. I personally give it 8.4/10 Extras  There is a HL2 mod that is basically a reskin of this game. Lambda wars, at this time the game is in Beta so it isn't finished obv, alot of things with be getting added such as Vehicles, more units and more factions. So far its combine vs rebels. Also its free!Its really cool playing from the perspective of a rebel/combine commander from the Hl2 universe.Also, hl2 being based in the future means more advanced tools such as invisible scanners, headcrab launchers, dark matter cannon, striders and more strange futuristic weaponry/items.Get it here

content:
Posted: November 25, 2010
												Company of Gyros is Relic's bold attempt to bring their experience on the sublime Homeworld 2 to the more down-to-earth genre of restaurant simulations. As the CEO of Gyros 'n Stuff, you control the national (and eventually multinational) policies of your gigantic corporation, but the game also allows you to micromanage various franchise owners if you wish. This is its greatest strength, because franchises in different regions have different challenges and objectives, and the higher level gameplay mirrors this, so that by spending time playing as these different franchises, you'll learn about the "realities on the ground" that are so crucial to success as a CEO. The endgame gets pretty bogged down because the game starts throwing lawsuits at you over the most tedious, petty details, and God help you if you actually did something REALLY bad. If your very first restaurant 10 years ago served ONE half-rat, half-lamb gyro on accident, you'll probably lose, long after you've quicksaved.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												i HIGHLY recommend this game, probably my favourite RTS game of all time! In the game, you choose between 2 sides: the United States or the Wehrmacht (German), and if you have the DLC for the game, you can also choose: The Commen Wealth or The Panzer Elite (which is pretty much the regular German team, but with different and/or more tank options and less infantry). The game includes a Singleplayer Campaign (which is expanded if you have the DLC), and great Multiplayer gameplay, with a bunch of maps to choose from, some maps being small for 1v1 matches, and some being massive for 4v4 matches. another thing really good about the multiplayer is most of the time the community is really good (of course, every once in a while you run into that guy who thinks he runs the show). ALSO, if u do happen to get bored after a while of playing the same thing over and over, there are LOTS of mods to choose from, for example: Modern Combat mod, Eastern Front mod and the Blitzkrieg mod. To sum it all up, excellent game! ARMOR IS GOOD TO GO!-------10/10 Shermans

												An instant classic.  Still play it today and with the Blitzkreig mod it looks even better with HD textures and many other features.  Also check out the Modern and WWI mod. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2013
												This is an outstanding strategy and tactics game! You never know how a battle will end and the battle can swing back and forth at a moments notice. Every little detail counts in this game, as simply facing a machine gun a certain direction can have it either hold off waves and waves of infantry or become easily overrun by a single squad of riflemen.Units are also a great aspect of this game, as every faction has tons of unique and individual units, and each army feels completely different from the others. These units all complement each other very nicely, and no sole unit can win the game. You must use your units to work together to defeat the enemy.Visually and graphically this game is very pleasing as well. Graphics are nice and detailed and the terrain is fully destructable. Sound is also great in this game, with especially great voice acting for all of the units keeping the game from becoming completely dark and depressing, with units occasionally cracking truly humorous remarks.Overall, this is a great game for anyone who likes strategy and tactics, and if you aren't sure if you want to get the second one yet due to it's still high price(although it is just as good as this game but even more improved) this is a great game to get into real time tactics.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
												The thing that sucks in this game is stats. When you join a game, you usually get kicked by the host because he saw your stats and it said that you lost games and won games. So I would absoloutly NOT recommend this game unless you prefer playing against and with AI or with friends and campaing mode. I honestly think this game is awesome, but it's just that there is a few things in the game that should be changed. This may sound like a bad review, but the pros outnumber the cons. I'd prefer COH 2 honestly. But this game is better that COH 2 in a lot of ways. Either though the cons are annoying, the game itself is awesome.8.5/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												Company of heroes is by far my all time favourite strategy/action game, I've played a lot of them. With its realistic graphics and gripping campaign, its hard for me to find anything wrong with this game. I guess however, there are a few things that I could be critical about.Firstly, vehicles and soilders in close quarters can often walk/drive through eachother, which although it is only a small thing in a game, for me it ruined the realism slightly. Secondly is the graphics, the graphics are fantastic on this game, but with good graphics comes more demand on your system to actually play the game, before I got my gaming computer I had to run this on Low/Medium quality settings, and even then it was quite jumpy, since then though, Ive managed to run it on ultra settings with little or no lag.Lastly, Relic online and multiplayer, as I've said I thoroughly enjoyed the campaign and I've had a lot of fun on singleplayer, but when I tried to play on multiplayer games there was quite a lot of hassle sorting it out, you need to set up a relic online account up and I experienced a few problems with that, but once I did manage to set it up, another problem arose, that being a lot of the games I try to connect to take forever to connect, and most of the time, at the end of the long wait, I am disconnected anyway.Overall however, a great game and definately worth the buy.Campaign 5/5Graphics 4/5Sound effects 4/5Singleplayer 4/5Multiplayer 3/5Overall 4/5

												Great game for lovers of RTS genre, you don't have to gather resouces but the resources you do have is a challenge to manage; buy a tank when you should've bought a AT gun? content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												i HIGHLY recommend this game, probably my favourite RTS game of all time! In the game, you choose between 2 sides: the United States or the Wehrmacht (German), and if you have the DLC for the game, you can also choose: The Commen Wealth or The Panzer Elite (which is pretty much the regular German team, but with different and/or more tank options and less infantry). The game includes a Singleplayer Campaign (which is expanded if you have the DLC), and great Multiplayer gameplay, with a bunch of maps to choose from, some maps being small for 1v1 matches, and some being massive for 4v4 matches. another thing really good about the multiplayer is most of the time the community is really good (of course, every once in a while you run into that guy who thinks he runs the show). ALSO, if u do happen to get bored after a while of playing the same thing over and over, there are LOTS of mods to choose from, for example: Modern Combat mod, Eastern Front mod and the Blitzkrieg mod. To sum it all up, excellent game! ARMOR IS GOOD TO GO!-------10/10 Shermans

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 14, 2013
												If you're looking for an RTS that can be enjoyable without having to Zerg Rush your way through gameplay, then look no further.  CoH is one of those few memorable strategy games that puts all others of it's genre to shame with it's dynamic game mechanics, impressive visual and audio (considering it's back from '06), and enticingly realistic scenarios.  A must-have for any fans of the more well-known RTS games such as Age of Empires, Starcraft/Warcraft, and Warhammer. Truly a sound investment that couldn't be wrong for anyone, I'd personally give this game a 9.5/10. (-.5 for a few minor flaws that could easily be overlooked)

content:
Posted: March 20, 2014
												This is one of the most overrated games I have played in many years. The praise given by critics and gamers to Company of Heroes is truly alarming. To play the game, you will be forced into signing up and logging into a Relic-Online account with your CD key. It doesn't matter if you're playing single player. Relic forces you into this DRM style process that is not even listed with Steam. This is absolutely unnacceptable and I feel misinformed by Steam and Relic. Relic had another idiotic idea. Menus for all three standalone Company of Heroes games are included, but locked. There are also two training missions from the second standalone game that appear, but are locked as well. Ridiculous. Upon first impressions (first four missions), the tactics appear to be slow, unrealistic, lacking in response, and surprisingly linear for a real-time strategy game. I am somewhat shocked, as this game has secured much hype over the years. The AI (of your own units and the enemy) is amazingly simple and limited. The units often have a hard time with your directions, and all units appear to be suffering from Alzheimer's disease. The AI is simply not up to standard. Many of your troops stand or sit around during a large generalized firefight, or have extremely bad shot accuracy. Saving and loading times (especially) are unexcusably long even with a modern computer. After you quit the game, Steam uploads/synchronizes several hundred megs each time. I understand I can turn this off. My complaint is the amount of space the Company of Heroes save games occupy without allowing you to delete previously saved games. Company of Heroes does not make this simple save game housekeeping possible. The game has some serious sound volume troubles in general, as it is abnormally low. Between the live action portion and the cutscenes, this problem is most serious. The cutscenes are much lower in volume in comparison. You will be restricted to constructing a very small amount of buildings (six) and only seven types of infantry troops. If the aforementioned buildings and units were more extensive with their usage and utility, I would not have much to gripe about. In reality, you will find that what you have access to is quite abridged for a game that came out in 2006. From the fifth mission on, things do get better and a tiny bit more exciting, even though it will continue to be almost an exact repetition of the first four missions. The gameplay is abbreviated, strikingly dull, laggard, close to being boring, and with little to no excitement. You select your squad(s), point them in a certain direction, select some inexstensive actions, watch some mildly interesting battle take place until the enemy troops are all dead, then capture a strategic point. That's it. There is really not much else to it. Even if the mission objectives change from mission to mission, the means you will exercise to achieve those goals will be the same. Construct buildings, generate units, upgrade, take over strategic points, repair units, replenish units, and then repeat. Once again, that's it. Company of Heroes does not provide the player with any fresh real-time strategy scope. This clumsy piece of software also managed to crash multiple times during the final mission.Company of Heroes is okay.

content:
Posted: November 15, 2016
Product received for free
												TL;DR- just buy it, it's a classic RTS, shame on you if you don't. Classic Real Time Strategy game. If you're new to real time strategy games, then I highly reccomend , and if you're an RTS vet, then you should still play. It's an excellent exciting game with well designed missions and decent "breifings" without too many constraints. I always feel like rts campaigns force you to play a certain way, but I don't have that problem with company of heroes I'll list my pro's and cons.Pros:-Dynamic gameplay, no feeling like mission after mission with a repeitive task. It feels like a natural progression.-Decent Campaign Length-In-game/In-game rendered cutscenes (Can be seen as a con, but I really like it. It makes you feel more invested when you zoom in)-Infantry can pick up weapons or man weapons that can turn into seperate units-It's during world war 2.Cons:-I ran into 3 glitches along the way. They're really simple to fix by just doing a quick google search for thr info.-Not too much unit variety, but in my opinion is made up for by the ability to man weapons and gain unit types by picking up items. You can also do this with weapons dropped by enemies.-seperate version for multiplayer is buggy af-F***ing annoying engineers with flame throwers sneaking behind your lines-limiting population cap

content:
Posted: November 16, 2013
												Delivering a visceral WWII gaming experience, Company of Heroes redefines real time strategy gaming by bringing the sacrifice of heroic soldiers, war-ravaged environments, and dynamic battlefields to life. Beginning with the D-Day Invasion of Normandy, players lead squads of Allied soldiers into battle against the German war machine through some of the most pivotal battles of WWII. Through a rich single player campaign, players experience the cinematic intensity and bravery of ordinary soldiers thrust into extraordinary events. - A Cinematic Single Player Experience that captures the turmoil of WWII as never before. Advanced squad AI brings your soldiers to life as they interact with the changing environment, take cover, and execute advanced squad tactics to eliminate all enemy opposition. - Stunning Visuals - Relic's next generation cutting-edge engine provides graphic quality and a physics driven world that is unprecedented in an RTS. - Environmental Strategy - Real-time physics and a completely destructible environment guarantee no two battles ever play out in the same way. Destroy anything and re-shape the battlefield! Use buildings and terrain to your advantage, or deny them to the enemy. 2-8 Player Multiplayer Competition via LAN or Internet - Go online with friends and join the ultimate battle of Axis versus Allies.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
												overall, I'm not impressed.Listen: I should not be able to throw infantry wave after infantry wave at a Panzer while drunk on a Saturday night and not be penalized. I beat the missions and got a few medals along the way, but I was never challenged, because (except for defensive missions), I knew none of it mattered. So what I lost the entire 5th US Army in an assault on a portapotty? Sucks to be their widows. I beat the mission and was on to the next. My lack of competence had no feedback. I had no want to get better, and no way to know that I sucked besides my own criticisms.It has good mechanics, sure. Troops go where I tell them to go, and shoot at what I want them to shoot at, but being smart has no real merit. Flanking means nothing unless you toss a grenade, because whether the Nazis are facing towards you or away from you, it doesn't matter. Your soliders shoot the same and don't take cover except or machine gun fire.Basically, play Close Combat: Invasion Normandy. If you suck at it, you won't win, and if you win, it's because you don't suck at it.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												I can see that by "not recommending" this version on Steam people will say your review is not helpful purely because of that reason- the actual review itself be damned. Because of that let me recommend this game but put a huge disclaimer about this Steam version of CoH right at the start:***What this game SAYS it is giving you and what is actually SOLD are two different items. LAN is not included in this sale; you will have to use SteamWorks which means if your internet is crap and you want this game for LAN games you are screwed (even thought it says it is offered). Buy used versions of this game and the expansions (seriously like $2.50, a massive difference in price) and then plug in your cd key into Steam and get the Steam version for free while retaining your ability to play LAN games. You get more for much less currently by going used and plugging in the keys. Until the issues are fixed this game and its expansions are grossly overpriced. Amazing game, don't waste the money on the current Steam versions.**The game (Current Steam Version with update) is suffering from major online failures across the board. Don't buy the game hoping to jump into PvP as it looks to be broken and doesn't look to have a fix in sight.*Buying the expansion Tales of Valor will open up LAN options for networked PC's, the base game will not allow it. Also you will have to buy the expansions in order to play as the British.Gamplay:This game is the greatest to date RTS game surrounding the events of WWII and might even be the greatest RTS game of all time. They introduced many things into the genre that hadn’t been seen before and honestly haven’t really been seen since as the genre seems to be dying out. Instead of having to manage hundreds of villagers telling them to get wood/stone etc (building an economy), you build structures that produce units and capture and hold key points on the map that give you resources to build said units. Some features such as having all your units visible on a side bar plus all of your groups you have created clearly labeled on the same side bar (as group 1, 2, etc) is absolutely priceless. You will never lose track of any of your units ever again. Also the ‘retreat’ option; oh… my… word… THANK YOU! SO often in these games you just want to have your people FLEEEEE! You can in this, and they will run (faster than normal) straight back to your base (not really firing in the process BUT taking less damage). These features are huge improvements to such a stale genre.Another huge factor that plays into this game play is that THIS IS NOT A 20 MINUTE RUSH GAME! As far as Starcraft and AoE’s are played most games are over in 15 minutes with a rush; this game is all tactics. Someone rushes something there are huge counter measures where certain troops do terrible vs others so you cannot just rush a single unit and go; huge tactics in this game. The majority of the game play involves fighting over key points and ‘bleeding’ the enemy out of resources as you chip away at his defenses. Snipers, MG teams, rifle squads, etc make up the bulk of what you build; most of the units are in ‘squad’s or ‘groups’ vs just being alone and you have to bunch them up. Cover (in buildings and in the world) is important and has huge effects on who will win the battle. All in all an extremely well-polished RTS with well-polished RTS mechanics.  To see my thoughts on other games, movies, and music (and their complete reviews) check out my blog found in my Steam profile or by Google (Search Ashley and Micah English) Thanks.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
												Inferior in every way to Dawn of War balance and AI. This eschews good RTS for gratifying the Idiocracy wave of gamers. Getting rid of real resource management makes the game more similar to Men of War; except CoH (both of them) suck compared to MoW at the tactical level. The complete lack of realism in the game also is a buzzkiller for any WW2 fan. Had they done something similar to their Dawn of War RTS games (not that DoW RPG wannabe RTS crap=DoW2) then this might have been a decent series. This game is best left to the insta-gratification console generation. More and more games have been getting dumbed down and require little brains, this series is an example of that. There are far better games out there that require much more intelligence and provide real gameplay. I'm afraid with this game all hope is lost for real RTS games made for adults instead of teenagers.

number of helpful: 12 of 36 people (33%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
												This game was really good in the past and is still is sort of an amazing rts game. But currently there are so many problems with this game and it is sort of ruining the fun in the game and I'll explain them all.1. The gameplay is extremly unbalanced: Mostly in favor of the axis. The axis tanks can easily counter almost anything that the allies through at them. For all honesty Panzer Elite can be extremly op first of all and the british are not certainly a good balancing factor to help out the allies. Panzer Elite has scout cars almost within minutes of starting the game and they can capture points and wipe out squads of engineers easily trying to capture them. They also extremly OP artillery based tanks which can easily be manuevered while the allies do not have manueverable aritillery which and unbalances the game even more. Second some infantry notes the Knights Cross holders are THREE MEN and are capable of wiping out 2 or even 3 squads easily. Their health is too high for infantry units and they are impossible to stop when they are in a cluster of 20-30. In fact I find it easier in some cases to take out axis tanks as allies then knights cross holders. Point is they are too OP and the allies do not even have any infantry troops to successfully counter them. Second a problem with both sides is that snipers are so OP. They uncover themselves and can easily go back into hiding after shooting. In all honesty, the camoflague feature should be wiped out and maybe instead of an extremly long range of site in that snipers could hide in the fog of war but become visible when shooting which would add to realism and help balance for the fact that snipers can camp inside a base and just keep on firing aritillery at the enemy base without even coming out of sight.But to some up you almost start to forget that the Allies won World War 2 for the fact that the Germans always win matches and destroy the ally armies so easily.2. The community isn't that great anymore. The old veteran players are running the show and pretty much taking up all the axis slots and dominating with the OP armies. In fact you can barely pull any wins as the allies anymore unless the axis players are noobs which is extremly rare. Also the veteran players don't even want to play with noobs and you will probably get kicked out of the game or moved to allies and called a noob just because you won 4 out 39 matches as allies. Its like sort of the community is redefining the word all together in that a noob is just someone who sucks instead of someone who is new to the game.Also to note I did not buy this game off steam and in fact i had it pretty much since it came out. It transfered to the steam version and it says I have 2 versions of the game for some reason a (New Steam Version and Regular). I have 42 hours on record for the (New Steam Version) and probably over 100 before I added it on steam. I know this game extremly well and love it but this review is out of complete honesty that this game has turned awful.

number of helpful: 1 of 12 people (8%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												Before you read this you should know I have player Men Of War.WHAT I DIDN'T LIKE:It would be an awesome game if it wasn't for the fact it's so unreal.Tanks have healthbars like a MMORPG troll, and its damage barely varies from where it is hit.Tanks can't use HE for a reason. Which results in 2 minutes of missing one soldier.I miss the direct control over units, cause they REALLY like to put their backs toward enemies.I don't get the point why the enemy keeps getting Stugs and Pz, while all I can do is set up mines which takes forever, resulting in leaving me defenseless.I have no idea why units can't throw multiple grenades (must wait 5 seconds), and why are they infinite.Units cannot run for their lives when pinned but throw themselves right into enemy fire. Like it would save them.In general the game is hard to understand because it isn't made in a way anyone could easily understand.Soldiers are really a general "thing" without different weapons.I am not sure if they can take a couple of hits or are this bad at aiming.WHAT I DID LIKE:The cinematics, they remind me of Band Of Brothers a little, are well made and makes you kind of bond with the NPC soldiers.Loved the TF2/AoE2 reference hitting things makes other things.I wouldn't reccomend this game for anyone new to strategy games, nor a veteran who has many more better games.

												Story: Game start with omaha beach that americans soldier attack german war machine on ww2 then game continue with ww2 that we all know but you only get germany vs america story so it's a incomplete game if you are looking for a complete ww2 game. 6/10 Cinematics:They are some good cinematics even after this many years.7/10Music and sounds:Divx Video's sound system make this games sounds awesome. 9/10Graphics:A bit outdated but still looks good sometimes 8/10Content:Lot's of content on online but basic copy paste strategy that work much better then other stuff.Single player content is incomplete cause it's only about germany vs america 6/10Controls:For a rts game they are normal and not awesome(sometimes your man stop walking and stand still even after your commands) 7/10Gameplay:It's was difficult for me cause capture and hold style rts can be really hard but it become much more easy after playing a map 100 ♥♥♥♥♥♥ time 6/10So an incomplete game about ww2 with not so awesome controls and a not very good gameplay so why the♥♥♥♥♥i still play this game? number of helpful: 3 of 17 people (18%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 23, 2013
												The incessant scrolling, squad menus, stupid squad response,  the inability of these soldiers and squads under my command to stay out of my line of site, or evade the enemy and enemy fire are the standards of video games these days.  it's not MY unfamiliarity with the controls, or recognize the positions of each unit, it is how poorly they are identified, or their position. The bumbling stupidity of these troops to execute orders without tripping over one another, or obstructing one another is stupifying. It's like trying to run a painting company with the three stooges, except it's an entire army of stooges in a restricted locational overview.Add to the sheer stupidity of these guys the macros, keybinds, tactics incongruity, and building area restrictions, and you have another frustrating exercise trying to coordinate strategies with illogical menu interfaces.More and more, I see developers who can't place menus in smart locations away from the center, out of the way, without obstructing MY view. It is funny how the robot invaders range, and field of view advantages exceed my own, and they trap my stupid army in an ambush while they move intelligently and easily to surround us. I save a lot of money on games now, but can't get refunds for glitchy, clumsy interfaces, and unfair 'stupid logic' as the only thing I have to command.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
												I did not enjoy this game, sadly after reading so many positive reviews all over the internet I decided to buy the complete pack.Firstly the AI is not good, even by 2006 standard.It feels too linear for it's scale. Not so many different ways to complete the objectives.You can't control individual soldiers, when they encounter a group of enemies they fire and throw grenades as they want to. You can control if they should hold fire or fire but nothing more in-depth than that.In a way it's Call of Duty in RTS form. Not very hard to learn, no complicated controls, your units can't do much more than move, cover and attack in one or two ways.It's a no-brainer to play. With all the pros and cons that come with it.The political symbols are censored (-historical accuracy) but there might be a mod texture for it.The effects and graphics are good for the game's age and the storyline is interesting at times.The environments are well made and adds abit of immersion.Most of the mission are defeat these enemies and capture this point or capture this point and get reinforcements, defend this position and get reinforcements and move on.I would recommend Men of War Assault Squad 1 or 2 instead. Bigger maps, indivdual unit and soldier control, more units, more destruction, more realistic, realistic damage to vehicles, more freedom of choice and good mod support.http://store.steampowered.com/search/?developer=Digitalmindsoft (Men of War link)

content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												A terribly overrated game - absolutely atrocious:The AI is terrible it's like everyone in this world has obsessive-compulsive disorder: mortar crews will get stuck in a repeating pattern of setting up and taking down over and over again. tanks will expose their rear to fire when you expressly tell them to keep their front to enemy; your soldiers and armor will automatically attack the enemy that poses the least threat, while letting  themselves get pounded into the dirt by other NPCs...even after you tell them expressly which enemy to focus on.balancing is terrible - apparantely, the "rules" don't apply to the game itself...just the player: expect NPC enemies to come from off screen at any given time from any given point on the map, rendering carefully placed layers of defense meaningless; expect enemies to pop up from nowhere like little weeds that spawned from the dirt; expect a RPG team to be able to destroy your tanks, even while your tank is shooting every single gun it has at them....and missing every f--king bullet. Line of sight and fog of war apparently doesn't seem to apply to the enemy NPCs.But if you enjoy wasting your money and  time, and are some sort of masochist who gets off on frustration, then this game is for you

												Clearly one of those games where the developers are meticulous in their testing. Even INCESSANT with it, perhaps?Either way, the results are plain to see.The end products are these highly fine-tuned game mechanics which allow you choose the type of commander you want to be, be it an infantry warlord, vehicle hero or support warrior. And yet, you're still able to compete with anyone and everyone, regardless of Which war Enthusiast you may choose to specialise in.One thing that many were concerned about on it's release was that Tanks would be able to moonwalk over everything. There was even concern that the infamous 1980's disco floor filler and megahit "Thriller", by the late, great, awe inspiring Michael Jackson, would come on every time someone used a tank. This is not the case at all, tanks are not invincible and can be destroyed using infantry. Infantry can do it. Trust me.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												THIS GAME! This game. It deserves your time and money. There is so much here that works for the game, the in battle talent tree, the unit system, destructable locations, and the capture/resource points give you the action and hectic nature of really world war 2 combat without the intense micro managment. I of all people do not like RTS games such as starcraft or war craft due to its incredibly steep learning curve for keyboard shortcuts and harvesting drones. However this game is such a treat that I was able to enjoy the RTS environment because the way the game is designed.Company of Heroes uses units that are grouped together. When you build a unit it comes in various amounts based on the group you chose, from low land infantry to engineers, and sniper units. This makes it easier to move groups around the battle field.Capture points afford resources that are added to your resource pool for ammo, gas, etc. This is a welcome change from harvesting because you don't have to worry about having units that can get "crystals" or cut down "trees" if you protect your control points you safeguard your resources.The talent tree works so well allowing you to invest points during the battle in infantry, tanks, or air support. It really cater's to your gameplay and gives variety to the combat, when you pull that final tiered ace out of your sleeve you feel really good about yourself and the devestation you can unleash to even the playing field again.I highly recommend this game to those who have a hard time getting into RTS's. I still dont play many mainstream RTS games but I know you will find this more enjoyable and solid to play with. Its a great game that deserves your time.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												My RTS skills are weak at best which could impact my judgement on a RTS game. Still, I think this game is great.Unlike old school mechanics where you have to build a base and gather resources, CoH just requires you to capture strategic points which will continually give resources as long as they are held. Base building is also very simplified with only a few buildings required to build.All this makes the game more straightforward and with a emphasis on tactical warfare. It's Relic at their best.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
												One of the best RTS games of all time. This games mechinics are a bit different then the average Command and Conqure or Starcraft base/army building. This game focuses on squads, instead of individual units, and it's through careful manuvering and stratagey with those units that this game truly shines. Resources are gained only through "Domination" Control points on the map. The history is acurate, afaik, and the detail in everything is stunning. If you haven't played this game and you consider yourself an RTS fan, then you had better pick this one up before anyone finds out your a faker.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 25, 2014
												If you are a fan of WWII and fast-paced strategy games that require minimal focus on economy and more on military, then this is the game for you. Resources are granted through the acquisition of key points in the map that will provide you with 1 of 3 resources: manpower, munitions, and fuel. Even though these points are vital for the economy side of the game, taking and maintaining these points requires a lot of focus on the size and positioning of one's military. As far as military units go, the game is just like any RTS game. You have light (infantry), medium (light vehicles), and heavy units (tanks) and counter units to different units in those classes. There are also three different branches for the Allies and Axis factions to choose from that will support you in commanding your troops on the battlefield. Support such as off-map artillery, increased abilities for units, and special units can be utilized to give you that extra edge against the enemy. Like I said, I would recommend buying this game not only because of the gameplay, but the amazing graphics and audio are a definite plus to the gameplay experience. Happy gaming!

Posted: January 11, 2014
												My RTS skills are weak at best which could impact my judgement on a RTS game. Still, I think this game is great.Unlike old school mechanics where you have to build a base and gather resources, CoH just requires you to capture strategic points which will continually give resources as long as they are held. Base building is also very simplified with only a few buildings required to build.All this makes the game more straightforward and with a emphasis on tactical warfare. It's Relic at their best.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
												One of the best RTS games of all time. This games mechinics are a bit different then the average Command and Conqure or Starcraft base/army building. This game focuses on squads, instead of individual units, and it's through careful manuvering and stratagey with those units that this game truly shines. Resources are gained only through "Domination" Control points on the map. The history is acurate, afaik, and the detail in everything is stunning. If you haven't played this game and you consider yourself an RTS fan, then you had better pick this one up before anyone finds out your a faker.
